item.title: Broken paving trip hazard remains, 25th July
item.description:
This slab has been working its way up for months. Someone has made it worse trying to repair it. Not only does the trip hazard remain, but the stone is now broken. Can someone come back and do a proper job and replace it?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London

item.title: Staircase smelling of urine, 25th July
item.description:
The communal staircase has not been mopped for a long time. Despite previous reports of urine left all the staircase leaving to the apartment the problem has not been sol ed and urine has been left to dry. The result is an umbeareable urine smell. This is all over both staircases that lead to the apartments
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavements broken or uneven, 25th July
item.description:

item.title: Fly-tipping outside bin strage room - again, 25th July
item.description:
Unfortunately, people are once again leaving their rubbish outside the bin storage room instead of disposing of it properly in the designated bins. This is a recurring issue that we are forced to deal with on a weekly basis. The waste attracts foxes, which tear open the bags, scattering litter along the pavement leading to the flats. In warmer weather, this also results in unpleasant odours. Regrettably, the warning sign against fly-tipping has not been effective in deterring this behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Wadhurst Close, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
